title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions for KRE

content.text: KRE goes public, offering shares on the stock market for the first time.
KRE undergoes a reverse stock split, consolidating every three shares into one.
KRE announces a stock split, increasing the number of shares outstanding by converting each share into 1.5 shares.
KRE executes a stock split, resulting in three shares for every existing share held.
KRE acquires XYZ Company, expanding its portfolio and market presence.
KRE raises its dividend payout to shareholders, signaling strong financial performance.
KRE announces a stock buyback program, intending to repurchase its own shares from the market.
KRE conducts a secondary offering, issuing additional shares to raise capital for business expansion.
